result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark J Kovach

records.addlTxt: Re: Order for payment and reimbursement to county
Plea hearing on April 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on May 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.
ADA Lech appears; Atty Mathie and Atty Cveykus appear for deft; Parties reach agreement;
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called:
INCLUDES: 21CF1053, 22CF93, 22CF108.
State appears by ADA Alex Lech in person. Defendant appeard in person, with Atty Jack Mathie and Atty Dan Cveykus;
VRCW.

Atty Cveykus is making a special appearance today on 22CF93 and 22CF108. 
Parties stipulate to the doctors report. 
COURT finds Defendant competent to proceed. 
Atty Mathie requests the COURT address counsel.
COURT questions Defendant regarding finances.
Defendant makes statement.
COURT finds Defendant indigent and appoints Atty Dan Cveykus at $100.00 per hour, $1,000.00 max.
Wage assignment $200.00 per month. 

DATES:
PTC w/JA: 4/6/22 @ 3:00 p.m. 

Adjourned: 2:46 p.m.

Case called: 9:53 a.m.
Clerk: Heather.      
INCLUDES: 21CF1053, 22CF93, 22CF108. 
State appears by ADA Alex Lech; Defendant appears w/Atty Kathryn Yanke;
VRCW.

Atty Yanke indicates her client has new charges and does not qualify for SPD or court appointed counsel. 
(OTR: 9:55 a.m. - BOTR: 9:57 a.m.)
Parties have had a chance to discuss resolution for the cases. 
Atty Yanke indicates her client is requesting a jury trial in 21CF1053 and is rejecting the offer.
Atty Yanke motions the COURT for a competency evaluation.
COURT orders competency evaluation.
Atty Yanke to submit order.

DATES:
Competency Hearing/TP: 3/16/22 @ 2:40 p.m. (20 mins)


Adjourned: 9:59 a.m.
Competency hearing on March 16, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
ATTIC:  Intake Report - Marathon County Pretrial Services Program

COURT denies appointment of counsel, defendant not found indigent.
Defendant waives time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

DATES:
Remove 2/2/22 RH and 2/7/22 PH.
PLEAH to remain.


Adjourned: 9:42 a.m.

Indigency hearing on January 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on February 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on February 7, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Plea hearing on February 9, 2022 at 09:50 am.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:17 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Alex Lech.  Defendant appears from MCJ, with Atty Aaron Damrau, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

COURT ORDERS: $2,000.00 signature bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No driving without valid DL. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  


DATES:
IH: 1/27/22 @ 9:30 a.m. BR 2.
RH: 2/2/22 @ 1:00 p.m. w/CC Baumann.
PH:2/7/22 @ 9:20 a.m. w/CC Baumann.
PLEAH: 2/9/22 @ 9:50 a.m. BR. 2.

INCLUDES: 22CF93, 22CF108.
Same Appearances.

COURT neglected to call 22CF108 earlier, and there needs to be an initial appearance.

Parties have no objections applying bond previously ordered to cover both files.

- No driving without valid DL. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

Previously stated dates to remain.
